availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Gemima Martin Clemons in Harrison County, Kentucky, in September 1842. Father of Mary Clemons, Benjamin T. Clemons, William Clemons, James Clemons, Martha Clemons, Nancy Clemons, John Clemons, Albert Clemons, and Francis M. Clemons. Farmer in Harrison County in 1850. Farmer in Harrison County in 1860. Farmer in Harrison County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 139A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 499.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, Berrys District, p. 86A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Harrison County Marriages, Film #000216896.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War) NARA RG 110, Harrison County, KY, June and July 1863, p. 52.
